"Allowable Cost" (as set forth in OMB Circular A-87) means those which meet
"Asset" means any valuable item that is owned or a future economic benefit
"Appropriation" means funds set aside for a specific purpose.
"Balance Sheet" means a statement of the assets, liabilities, and fund bala
"Budget" means an itemized summary of probable income and approved expendit
"Capital Project Funds" means funds to account for financial resources to b
"Chart of Accounts" means a list of all account numbers used by an organiza
"Credit" means the right side of an account.
"Debit" means the left side of an account.
"Debt Service Funds" means an account for the accumulation of resources for
"Deferred Compensation Fund" means the fund used to account for assets held
"Deferred Revenue" means revenue that is not yet recognized.
"Direct Cost" means any cost which can be specifically identified with a pa
"Disbursement" means funds paid out.
"Discretionary Funds" means funds that may be spent as the Tribal Governing
"Enterprise Funds" means an account for business operations financed and op
"Encumbrance" means commitments related to unperformed contracts for goods
"Equipment Purchase" means the expense line item used to record equipment p
"Expense" means a decrease in financial resources.
"Fiduciary Funds" means funds held by a governmental unit in a trustee capa
"Financial Department" means the accounting department of the Tribe.
"Fixed Asset" means a single tangible item valued at $2,000 or more with a
"Fringe Benefit" means any property, service, cash or cash equivalent provi

"Generally Accepted Accounting Principles or GAAP" means the rules of accou
"General Fixed Assets" means capital assets which are not assets of any fun
"General Fixed Assets Account Group" means those fixed assets which are not

"Governmental Funds" means the funds used to finance most governmental func
"Indirect Cost" means costs incurred for a common or joint purpose benefiti
"Internal Service Funds" means funds to account for the financing of goods
"Journal Entry" means a two-sided entry consisting of a debit and a credit
"Liability" means the obligations of an entity, such as accounts payable.
"Payee" means the one to whom money is to be paid.
"Post" means to record an item in the general ledger.
"Proprietary Funds" means funds used to account for governmental activities

c.x: No person will have complete control over all phases of any significant tra
Whenever possible, the flow of work will be from one employee to another so
Responsibilities in the fiscal department will be clearly established and f
The function of receiving cash will be centralized in one person, who will
In receiving cash through the mail, the person responsible for opening the
Record keeping will be separated from operations or the handling and custod
All cash receipts will be deposited intact and for the full amount received
All collections will be deposited as soon as possible, preferably the day r
The following will be adhered to when handling cash:
Collections and all other funds held within an office pending regular depos
Uncollectible items and related documents will not be handled by the person
If possible, persons preparing payrolls or time reporting records will not
Bank statements will be reconciled promptly to the formal accounting record
The number of bank accounts and inter-bank transfers will be kept to a mini
Checks will not be issued to "cash" or "bearer;"
Check signers will not sign blank checks; and
Records of void checks will be kept. When possible the actual void check wi
The following will be adhered to when issuing checks:
